lines.text: I bet your father spent the first year of your life throwing rocks at the stork.
I've waited so long to find someone like you.
Oh, someone *like* me, I'm not good enough for you, eh?

[a giraffe licks her neck]
Not here, monsieur. Not here.
Oh, I can't help it. It's just the animal in me.
I'll grill her until she's well done! She must know something about this case.
You're the man I've been dreaming of!
What do you eat before you go to bed?
Oh, but, you don't have to go right now, do you?
Well, there's nothing to keep me here that I can see, from this angle.
But, we, we hardly know each other. I can be very entertaining if I want to be.

[Speaking directly to the camera]
There must be some way of getting that money without getting in trouble with the Hays Office.
[Speaking to Pauline]
Will you walk on your hands?
Folks, I wanna you should meet my pal! My best friend! What's your name again?

[annoyed]
Loophole.

[shaking his hand]
Glad to know ya!
It's your pleasure.
You know what I say. Whenever you got business trouble the best thing to do is to get a lawyer. Then you got more trouble, but at least you got a lawyer.
But it's so easy. The bottom of your shoe creates a suction that holds you up on the ceiling.
No, no, I'd rather not. I have an agreement with the houseflies. The flies don't practice law and I don't walk on the ceiling.
You know, If you hadn't sent for me, I'd probably be at home now, in a nice warm bedroom, in a comfortable bed, with a Hot Toddy!
Huh?
That's a drink!
If you please, Mistah Carter?
What do you want?
Can I have a month off next August?
What for?
Well, you see, my lawyer, he got-a me a divorce, and one month every year I win the custody of my wife's parents.
Ah ah! Bad luck, three on a midget!
You're like a beautiful chandelier. I'd like to be around when you get lit up.
You know what I think? The guy who hit Jeff on the head and knocked him out didn't like him.
Now let's not jump to concussions.
O, Susanna, o, Susanna
[Starts singing]
Oh, won't you fly with me/for I need $10,000 'cause the Sheriff's after me.
I ain't got nothing, but you can always have half!
We must have regard for certain conventions.
One guy isn't enough. She's gotta have a convention.

[shortly after Goliath and Punchy walked into the big top, an announcer mentions that Goliath is to catch three one-hundred pound cannon balls, one at a time and Punchy lights three cannons one at a time toward Goliath. The first and third cannon fuses function correctly. After Goliath caught first cannonball second cannon's fuse faltered, Goliath then claps his hands twice, motioning for Punchy, to light the third cannon. After Goliath successfully caught the first and third cannon balls, he then turn around accepting the applause. As Goliath is turned around, accepting the applause, the second cannon ball goes off and its cannonball popped Goliath, in his rear end! Then the crowd starts laughing extremely loud! Goliath, after being "popped in his rear", is so exasperated that he throws his barbell at Punchy]
Why, I'll fix you!
[When Punchy is hit by the Goliath's barbell, only his head appears, above the ground]

Ah, this meeting brings back memories, childhood days. Lemonade! Romance! My life was wrapped around the circus. Her name was Lydia. I met her at the world's fair in 1900, walked down from 1940. Ah, Lydia. She was the most gloooooooooorius creature under the sun. Thaïs! du Barry! Garbo! Rolled up into one... Ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, Lydia, oh Lydia, say have you met Lydia? Lydia, the tattooed lady...
What do you want?
Oh, sure, we come in if you insist.
Is this a friend of yours?
I should say not, he's a lawyer.
No thanks, I'll sit this one out. I'm just an old groundhog. I shouldn't even be out until February.
Oh, you'll love it! Come on, Cheever.
Are you sure we are not being too hasty. After all, I am just a boy. You're, you're a trooper, an aerial star.
Yes. You could be too. You're tall. You're strong.
You're nearsighted!
Once you do this, you'll never forget it.

[Watching 'Punchy' taming the circus lions playing a miniature trombone]
Well, shut my mouth and freeze my face. That man don't belong to no human race.
Got a hocu-hocus pocus and a fiddle dee dee dee. That could charm a lion and a chimpanzee.
Yodelaheehoo! Mrs. Dukesbury! Yoohoo!
Well! What is the meaning of this?
Keep your sheet on, I'm looking for old lady Dukesbury.
I am Mrs. Dukesbury.
Snook'ems!
[Rushes to her arms]
Oh, good gracious! I don't know you.
You mean you've, you've forgotten?
Well, I...

I know, you have forgotten. Those June nights on the Riviera, where we sat 'neath the shimmering skies! Moonlight bathing in the Mediterranean! We were young, gay, reckless! The night I drank champagne from your slipper - two quarts. It would have held more, but you were wearing inner soles! Oh, Hildegarde!
My name is Suzanna!
Let's not quibble!
Now, be sure; when the Normandy docks tomorrow in New York, the Jardinet and his entire orchestra come directly here.
This bedroom will be awfully crowded.
Suzanna, I-eh-I hate to bring up money matters in the bedroom, but, eh...
But, what!
Well, eh, just write me out a check for ten thousand dollars and everybody will be happy including the gorilla. And, I do mean you.

[Talking to 'Punchy' in the train's sleeper car]
How can you fall asleep? Oh, you count-a sheep, heh? How many sheep you have to count before you fall asleep? One! Eh, you're an insta-maniac.

[Picks up phone]
Operator, operator! Get me the steamship Normandy. Where is it? It's in the water.
Why I can't believe it.
But I tell you the man's name is not Jardinet! His real name is V. T. O'Connor.
No there must be some mistake. Are you sure?
I'm positive. It's the biggest dope ring in years and Jardinet is the head dope. Now, keep him in the brig until I can dig up some more dope. This is Operator 77B signing off. That is all.
Pardon me, Madame, but here are the seating arrangements for your final approval.
Oh, no, Whitcomb. Judge Chinner will sit on my left hand and you
[turning to look at Loophole]
will sit on my right hand.
How will you eat? Through a tube?
I cross the ocean! I am called a dope ring! I race on a train, when I get here, what do I find? Animals. Animals!
Animals?
Animals! Mrs. Dukesbury's friends are my friends!
Now, I know you will all be thrilled. Jardinet's opening number will be Beethoven's somber, spiritual first movement of his second concerto, album three, opus four...
And number five on the Hit Parade.
You, monster. You're responsible this disgrace!
That's gratitude for you. Most men get their sweethearts one ring for an engagement. I got you three rings!
A circus! I'll be a laughing stock.
Get me out of this cannon! Get me out of this cannon! Please, get me out of this cannon!
